edge_sources.documentation: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux)

edge_sources.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

edge_sources.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

edge_sources.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

edge_sources.grid_ggd.documentation: Grid (using the Generic Grid Description), for various time slices. The timebase of this array of structure must be a subset of the ggd timebases

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].grid_subset[:]..documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.
Metric Jacobian
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Lower error for "jacobian"
Upper error for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Lower error for "tensor_contravariant"
Upper error for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"
Lower error for "tensor_covariant"
Upper error for "tensor_covariant"
Space dimension of the grid subset elements. This must be equal to the sum of the dimensions of the individual objects forming the element.
Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces
Set of objects defining the element
Dimension of the object
Object index
Index of the space from which that object is taken

Grid subset identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) nodes : All nodes belonging to the associated spaces
2) faces : All faces belonging to the associated spaces
3) x_aligned_faces : All x-aligned (poloidally) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
4) y_aligned_faces : All y-aligned (radially) aligned faces belonging to the associated spaces
5) cells : All cells belonging to the associated spaces
6) x_points : Nodes defining x-points
7) core_cut : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the active x-point
8) PFR_cut : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the active x-point
9) outer_throat : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the active x-point
10) inner_throat : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the active x-point
11) outer_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to outer midplane on the separatrix
12) inner_midplane : y-aligned faces connecting to the node closest to inner midplane on the separatrix
13) outer_target : y-aligned faces defining the outer target
14) inner_target : y-aligned faces defining the inner target
15) core_boundary : Innermost x-aligned faces
16) separatrix : x-aligned faces defining the active separatrix
17) main_chamber_wall : x-aligned faces defining main chamber wall outside of the divertor regions
18) outer_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer active divertor region
19) inner_baffle : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner active divertor region
20) outer_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer active divertor region
21) inner_PFR_wall : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner active divertor region
22) core : Cells inside the active separatrix
23) sol : Cells defining the main SOL outside of the divertor regions
24) outer_divertor : Cells defining the outer divertor region
25) inner_divertor : Cells defining the inner divertor region
26) core_sol : x-aligned faces defining part of active separatrix separating core and sol
27) full_main_chamber_wall : main_chamber_wall + outer_baffle(s) + inner_baffle(s)
28) full_PFR_wall : outer_PFR__wall(s) + inner_PFR_wall(s)
29) core_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces inside the separatrix connecting to the non-active x-point
30) PFR_cut_X2 : y-aligned faces in the private flux region connecting to the non-active x-point
31) outer_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the outer SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
32) inner_throat_X2 : y-aligned faces in the inner SOL connecting to the non-active x-point
33) separatrix_2 : x-aligned faces defining the non-active separatrix
34) outer_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the outer non-active divertor region
35) inner_baffle_2 : x-aligned faces defining the chamber wall of the inner non-active divertor region
36) outer_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the outer non-active divertor region
37) inner_PFR_wall_2 : x-aligned faces defining the private flux region wall of the inner non-active divertor region
38) intra_sep : Cells between the two separatrices
39) outer_divertor_2 : Cells defining the outer inactive divertor region
40) inner_divertor_2 : Cells defining the inner inactive divertor region
41) outer_target_2 : y-aligned faces defining the outer inactive target
42) inner_target_2 : y-aligned faces defining the inner inactive target
101) outer_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer mid-plane
102) inner_mid_plane_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner mid-plane
103) outer_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at outer active target
104) inner_target_separatrix : Point on active separatrix at inner active target
105) outer_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at outer non-active target
106) inner_target_separatrix_2 : Point on non-active separatrix at inner non-active target
Verbose description
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Short string identifier
Metric of the canonical frame onto Cartesian coordinates
Metric Jacobian
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Lower error for "jacobian"
Upper error for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Lower error for "tensor_contravariant"
Upper error for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)

Upper error for "tensor_covariant"

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].identifier.documentation:
Grid identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) linear : Linear
2) cylinder : Cylindrical geometry (straight in axial direction)
3) limiter : Limiter
4) SN : Single null
5) CDN : Connected double null
6) DDN_bottom : Disconnected double null with inner X-point below the midplane
7) DDN_top : Disconnected double null with inner X-point above the midplane
8) annulus : Annular geometry (not necessarily with straight axis)
9) stellerator_island : Stellarator island geometry

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].identifier.inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].space[:].coordi.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therfore defines the dimension of the space. The meaning of these predefined integer constants can be found in the documentation of the grid service library

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].space[:].geomet.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].space[:].identi.documentation:
Space identifier
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) primary_standard : Primary space defining the standard grid
2) primary_staggered : Primary space defining a grid staggered with respect to the primary standard space
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

edge_sources.grid_ggd[:].space[:].object.documentation: Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.
Set of objects for a given dimension
Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object
List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered.
Index in the error_description list for "geometry"
Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...)
Index in the error_description list for "measure"
List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)

edge_sources.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

edge_sources.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

edge_sources.ids_properties.creation_dat.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

edge_sources.ids_properties.homogeneous_.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

edge_sources.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

edge_sources.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

edge_sources.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

edge_sources.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

edge_sources.ids_properties.version_put..documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

edge_sources.source[:].ggd.documentation: Source terms represented using the general grid description, for various time slices

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].current[:].documentation: Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).

edge_sources.source[:].ggd_fast.documentation: Quantities provided at a faster sampling rate than the full ggd quantities. These are either integrated quantities or local quantities provided on a reduced set of positions. Positions and integration domains are described by a set of grid_subsets (of size 1 for a position).

edge_sources.source[:].identifier.documentation:
Source term identifier (process causing this source term)
0) unspecified : Unspecified source type
1) total : Combined source excluding time derivative
702) total_linearized : Combined source (linearized) excluding time derivative
703) background : Background source
801) database : Source from database entry
705) prescribed : Source prescribed from code input parameters
706) time_derivative : Source associated with time derivative
707) atomic_ionization : Source from atomic ionization
708) molecular_ionization : Source from molecular ionization/dissociation
709) ionization : Source from ionization (combined)
710) recombination : Source from recombination
305) charge_exchange : Source from charge exchange. Charge exchange losses are negative sources
11) collisional_equipartition : Collisional equipartition
7) ohmic : Source from ohmic heating
200) radiation : Source from line + recombination assisted + bremstrahlung
715) compression : Internal energy source from compression
716) bulk_motion : Internal energy source correction for bulk motion

edge_sources.source[:].identifier.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

edge_sources.source[:].species.documentation: Species causing this source term (if relevant, e.g. a particular ion or neutral state in case of line radiation)

edge_sources.source[:].species.ion.documentation: Description of the ion or neutral species, used if type/index = 2 or 3

edge_sources.source[:].species.ion.eleme.documentation: List of elements forming the atom or molecule
Index in the error_description list for "a"
Number of atoms of this element in the molecule
Index in the error_description list for "multiplicity"
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

edge_sources.source[:].species.ion.label.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

edge_sources.source[:].species.ion.state.documentation: Quantities related to the different states of the species (ionisation, energy, excitation, ...)
Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1
String identifying ion state (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)
Index in the error_description list for "vibrational_level"
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.
Maximum Z of the charge state bundle (equal to z_min if no bundle)
Index in the error_description list for "z_max"
Minimum Z of the charge state bundle (z_min = z_max = 0 for a neutral)
Index in the error_description list for "z_min"

edge_sources.source[:].species.ion.z_ion.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed)
Index in the error_description list for "z_ion"

edge_sources.source[:].species.neutral.documentation: Description of the neutral species, used if type/index = 4 or 5

Number of atoms of this element in the molecule
Index in the error_description list for "multiplicity"
Index in the error_description list for "z_n"

edge_sources.source[:].species.neutral.l.documentation: String identifying neutral (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

edge_sources.source[:].species.neutral.s.documentation: Configuration of atomic orbitals of this state, e.g. 1s2-2s1

Neutral type, in terms of energy. ID =1: cold; 2: thermal; 3: fast; 4: NBI
1) cold : Cold neutrals
2) thermal : Thermal neutrals
3) fast : Fast neutrals
4) nbi : NBI neutrals
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Index in the error_description list for "vibrational_level"
Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature.

edge_sources.source[:].species.type.documentation:
Species type. index=1 for electron; index=2 for ion species in a single/average state (refer to ion structure); index=3 for ion species in a particular state (refer to ion/state structure);  index=4 for neutral species in a single/average state (refer to neutral structure); index=5 for neutral species in a particular state (refer to neutral/state structure);  index=6 for neutron; index=7 for photon
0) unspecified : unspecified
1) electron : Electron
2) ion : Ion species in a single/average state; refer to ion-structure
3) ion_state : Ion species in a particular state; refer to ion/state-structure
4) neutral : Neutral species in a single/average state; refer to neutral-structure
5) neutral_state : Neutral species in a particular state; refer to neutral/state-structure
6) neutron : Neutron
7) photon : Photon

edge_sources.source[:].species.type.inde.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
